import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Generate x values from 0 to 2Ï€
x = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, 100)
# Compute the sine of x
y = np.sin(x)

# Create a plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))
plt.plot(x, y, label='Sine Wave', color='blue')

# Add title and labels
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x (radians)')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.axhline(0, color='black',linewidth=0.5, ls='--')
plt.axvline(0, color='black',linewidth=0.5, ls='--')
plt.grid()

print("Plot created")

# Add a legend
plt.legend()

import numpy as np

# Create two numpy arrays
array1 = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
array2 = np.array([6, 7, 8, 9, 10])

# Perform basic operations
sum_array = array1 + array2
product_array = array1 * array2
mean_array1 = np.mean(array1)
mean_array2 = np.mean(array2)

# Print results
print("Array 1:", array1)
print("Array 2:", array2)
print("Sum of Arrays:", sum_array)
print("Product of Arrays:", product_array)
print("Mean of Array 1:", mean_array1)
print("Mean of Array 2:", mean_array2)

import pandas as pd

# Create a dictionary of data
data = {
    'Name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'Age': [24, 30, 22, 35],
    'City': ['New York', 'Los Angeles', 'Chicago', 'Houston']
}

# Create a DataFrame from the dictionary
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Display the DataFrame
print("Original DataFrame:")
print(df)

# Calculate the mean age
mean_age = df['Age'].mean()

# Add a new column for Age Group
df['Age Group'] = pd.cut(df['Age'], bins=[20, 25, 30, 40], labels=['20-25', '26-30', '31-40'])

# Display the updated DataFrame
print("\nUpdated DataFrame with Age Group:")
print(df)

# Print the mean age
print("\nMean Age:", mean_age)
